of Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2011. Both on-premises and cloud-based versions of the platform will be available in 40 markets and 41 languages starting Feb. 28. A Jan. 17 statement by Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer emphasized Dynamics CRM's familiar user experience, enabling greater collaboration, streamlining of processes and access to real-time data. Microsoft finds itself locked in fierce battle for CRM market-share with Salesforce.com and Oracle, both of which have shown little hesitation in both updating their products and sniping at their rivals.
